brandContext.tone: Warm but direct, premium but accessible, anti-hustle pro-freedom
signatureClosings: Do meu coracao para o seu

button.description: Interactive element that triggers actions. Seja Livre buttons use warm, inviting language that empowers rather than commands.
button.brandNotes: Use 'VAMOS?' style text for primary CTAs. Never use generic 'Submit' or 'Clique aqui'. Buttons should feel like an invitation from a friend, not a corporate command.

primary.description: Main call-to-action, use sparingly (1-2 per viewport)

accent.usage: Special offers, milestone celebrations, golden moments

ghost.description: Tertiary actions that don't compete with primary CTAs

destructive.usage: Cancel subscription, delete account (rare, supportive messaging)

accessibility.focusManagement: Focus ring visible on keyboard navigation, hidden on mouse click

do.rule: Use warm, inviting language like 'VAMOS?' or 'Quero minha liberdade'
do.rationale: Aligns with brand's Libertadora personality and creates emotional connection

do.rule: Limit primary buttons to 1-2 per viewport
do.rationale: Maintains visual hierarchy and prevents decision fatigue

do.rule: Include loading states for async actions
Use accent buttons for celebratory moments
do.rationale: Gold color represents freedom and transformation achievements

dont.rule: Don't use generic text like 'Clique aqui' or 'Submit'
dont.rationale: Misses opportunity to reinforce brand voice and create connection

dont.rule: Don't disable buttons without explanation
dont.rationale: Brand is supportive, not blaming; show why action is blocked

dont.rule: Don't use destructive styling for non-destructive actions
Don't stack multiple buttons of same hierarchy

input.description: Text input fields for forms. Seja Livre inputs feel approachable and guide users gently through data entry.
input.brandNotes: Use supportive placeholder text that guides rather than demands. Error messages should be helpful, never blaming. Consider the user is likely busy and stressed.

accessibility.autocomplete: Use appropriate autocomplete values (email, name, tel, etc.)

examples.required: Esse campo e importante pra gente te conhecer melhor
examples.email: Hmm, esse email nao parece completo. Pode verificar?
examples.password: A senha precisa de pelo menos 8 caracteres pra te proteger
examples.mismatch: As senhas nao estao iguais ainda. Sem pressa!
examples.invalid: Algo nao ficou certo aqui. Vamos tentar de novo?

do.rule: Use clear, descriptive labels above inputs
do.rationale: Labels remain visible when typing, improving usability

do.rule: Show validation feedback immediately after field loses focus
do.rationale: Helps users correct errors before submission
Brand voice is supportive, not blaming

do.rule: Provide helper text for complex requirements
do.rationale: Guides users proactively rather than reactively

dont.rule: Don't use placeholder as the only label
Don't use red for all error styling
dont.rationale: Combine with icons and text for accessibility

dont.rule: Don't blame the user in error messages
dont.rationale: Misaligns with warm, supportive brand voice

dont.rule: Don't auto-focus inputs without user action
dont.rationale: Can disorient users, especially with screen readers

textarea.description: Multi-line text input for longer content like messages, descriptions, or feedback.
textarea.brandNotes: Perfect for personal messages. Use encouraging placeholders that invite sharing.

do.rule: Show character count for limited fields

dont.rule: Don't make minimum height too small
Don't hide overflow without indication
dont.rationale: Users may not realize content is cut off

select.description: Dropdown selection component for choosing from predefined options.
select.brandNotes: Keep options concise and clear. Use natural language for option labels.

do.rule: Add search for lists with 10+ options

dont.rule: Don't use select for fewer than 4 options
Don't nest dropdowns

checkbox.description: Binary selection control for independent choices or list items.
checkbox.brandNotes: Use for terms acceptance, preferences, and multi-select lists. Keep labels conversational.

dont.rule: Don't use for mutually exclusive options
Don't default to checked without clear reason

radio.description: Selection control for mutually exclusive choices within a group.
radio.brandNotes: Use for single-choice selections like payment methods, delivery options. Keep groups to 5 or fewer options.

dont.rule: Don't use for more than 5-7 options
Don't mix with checkboxes in same context

toggle.description: Binary switch for instant on/off settings that take effect immediately.
toggle.brandNotes: Use for settings and preferences. Toggle should feel satisfying with smooth animation.

do.rule: Use for settings that take effect immediately

dont.rule: Don't use for form submissions
Don't use confusing labels like 'Don't show again'

card.description: Container for grouping related content and actions. Cards create visual hierarchy and chunking.
card.brandNotes: Cards should feel like warm invitations, not cold containers. Use rounded corners for approachability. Background is pure white on cream page background.

accessibility.focusManagement: Focus ring on card when interactive

do.rule: Use consistent padding within card types
Include clear visual hierarchy in card content
Use white background on cream page background
do.rationale: Creates subtle elevation without heavy shadows

dont.rule: Don't nest cards within cards
Don't make entire card clickable if it has multiple actions
Don't use heavy shadows

modal.description: Overlay dialog that focuses attention and requires user action. Blocks page interaction.
modal.brandNotes: Modals interrupt flow, use sparingly. Content should feel like a conversation, not a transaction. Include warm closings.

focusManagement.onOpen: Focus first focusable element or close button

do.rationale: Brand voice should persist in modals

dont.rule: Don't open modals on page load
Don't nest modals
Don't use for simple messages
dont.rationale: Toast or inline alerts are less disruptive

alert.description: Inline message banners for system feedback, warnings, or important information.
alert.brandNotes: Alerts should feel supportive, not alarming. Error messages guide rather than blame. Success celebrates achievements warmly.

error.brandNote: Never blame: 'Hmm, algo nao deu certo. Vamos resolver?'

warning: Ei, so um detalhe: sua sessao vai expirar em 5 minutos.
error: Hmm, algo nao deu certo. Vamos tentar de novo?
Ops! Parece que houve um problema. Estamos trabalhando nisso.
Nao conseguimos processar isso agora. Pode tentar novamente?
info: Bom saber: voce pode editar isso a qualquer momento.
Dica: clique aqui pra ver mais opcoes.

do.rule: Use appropriate variant for message type
Include dismiss option for non-critical alerts

dont.rule: Don't use error styling for non-errors
Don't blame the user in error messages
Don't stack multiple alerts

tabs.description: Navigation component for switching between related content sections.
tabs.brandNotes: Tabs should feel like natural conversation sections, not rigid categories. Active state uses primary navy.

styles.underline: Active tab indicated by bottom border

do.rationale: Users scan tabs to find content

dont.rule: Don't use tabs for sequential steps
Don't hide critical content in tabs

navigation.description: Primary site navigation including navbar and mobile menu.
navigation.brandNotes: Navigation should feel guiding, not overwhelming. Logo links home. Keep nav items minimal. Include CTA button prominently.

styles.transparent: For hero sections, becomes solid on scroll

dont.rule: Don't use more than 7 top-level nav items
Don't hide mobile menu trigger

footer.description: Site footer with navigation, contact info, and legal links.
footer.brandNotes: Footer should feel like a warm goodbye. Include signature closing phrase. Navy background creates visual anchor.

brandElements.signatureClosing: Do meu coracao para o seu
brandElements.tagline: Empreenda com leveza, cresca com liberdade

do.rationale: Users often look in footer for contact

dont.rule: Don't overload with too many links
dont.rationale: Footer should be scannable, not exhaustive

dont.rule: Don't use tiny text for legal links

breadcrumbs.description: Navigation showing current location in site hierarchy.
breadcrumbs.brandNotes: Keep labels short and clear. Use forward arrow as separator for warmth.

do.rule: Make all but current item clickable

dont.rule: Don't show breadcrumbs on homepage
Don't truncate middle items without indication

pagination.description: Navigation for multi-page content like blog listings or search results.
pagination.brandNotes: Keep pagination simple and approachable. Use clear labels for previous/next.

do.rule: Use ellipsis for large page counts

dont.rule: Don't show pagination for single page

toast.description: Temporary notification that appears and auto-dismisses. Non-blocking feedback.
toast.brandNotes: Toasts should feel like friendly updates, not interruptions. Use brand voice for messages. Auto-dismiss after appropriate duration.

success: Feito! Voce ta no caminho certo.
error: Ops! Algo deu errado. Vamos tentar de novo?
Nao conseguimos fazer isso agora. Tenta mais tarde?
info: So pra voce saber: suas alteracoes foram salvas automaticamente.

do.rule: Use appropriate duration for message importance
do.rationale: Errors need more time to read

dont.rule: Don't use toasts for critical actions requiring confirmation
dont.rationale: Too easy to miss; use modal instead

dont.rule: Don't show too many toasts at once

progressIndicator.description: Visual feedback showing progress through a process or loading state.
progressIndicator.brandNotes: Progress should feel encouraging, not anxiety-inducing. Use warm colors and supportive messaging.

do.rule: Add encouraging copy for longer waits
do.rationale: Brand voice should persist: 'So mais um momento...'

dont.rule: Don't show fake progress
Don't use progress bar for indeterminate waits

badge.description: Small visual label for status, category, or count information.
badge.brandNotes: Badges should be informative, not shouty. Use accent gold for special/premium indicators.

accessibility.useAriaLabel: When badge is icon-only or count
accessibility.colorContrast: All badge text meets WCAG AA

do.rule: Use consistent colors for same status types

do.rationale: Badges are meant for quick scanning

dont.rule: Don't use too many badges in one area
Don't use badges for long text

avatar.description: Visual representation of a user, typically showing image or initials.
avatar.brandNotes: Avatars humanize the experience. Use warm fallback colors. Support for Jucana's signature look.

accessibility.imageAlt: Required for images, use person's name

do.rule: Always provide alt text for images

dont.rule: Don't use generic stock photos
Don't crop faces awkwardly

tooltip.description: Contextual help text that appears on hover/focus.
tooltip.brandNotes: Tooltips should be helpful and conversational. Keep text brief but warm.

accessibility.touchDevice: Tap to show, tap elsewhere to hide

do.rule: Keep tooltip text brief (1-2 sentences max)
Make tooltips accessible via keyboard focus

dont.rule: Don't put essential info in tooltips only
Don't use tooltips for complex content

ctaSection.description: Hero call-to-action blocks for driving primary conversions. Brand-specific component for Seja Livre.
ctaSection.brandNotes: CTA sections are where brand voice shines brightest. Use provocative questions, warm invitations, and signature closings. Gold accent for premium moments.

headlines: Voce esta pronta pra parar de carregar a empresa nas costas?
E se voce pudesse trabalhar menos e crescer mais?
Liberdade nao e sonho. E metodo.
subheadlines: 10x mais resultados com 10x menos esforco. Nao e magia. E processo.
Eu tambem ja chorei no banheiro da empresa. Hoje, meu negocio roda sem mim.
closings: Do meu coracao para o seu

accessibility.contrastRatio: All text meets WCAG AA minimum

do.rule: Use provocative questions that resonate with target audience
do.rationale: Brand voice hooks through identification with pain

dont.rule: Don't use generic CTA text like 'Clique aqui'
Don't overload with multiple CTAs
Don't use hustle/grind language

testimonialCard.description: Social proof component featuring customer quotes, optionally with video overlay capability.
testimonialCard.brandNotes: Testimonials are powerful proof points. Feature real names and specific results. Video testimonials are premium. Use warm framing.

types.featured: Large quote with avatar and details

introFraming: A [Nome] achava que liberdade era coisa de coach motivacional. Ate o dia que ela tirou 30 dias de ferias e o faturamento SUBIU:
Quando a [Nome] chegou, trabalhava 16 horas por dia. Hoje:
resultFormats: Primeiras ferias de verdade em 8 anos

do.rule: Use real names and specific results

dont.rule: Don't use stock photos for avatars
Don't fabricate or exaggerate results
Don't use testimonials without permission

whatsappButton.description: Floating action button for WhatsApp contact. Key conversion element for Seja Livre.
whatsappButton.brandNotes: WhatsApp is primary contact channel. Button should be prominent but not obstructive. Use brand green for WhatsApp, not generic green.

behavior.defaultMessage: Oi! Vi o site e quero saber mais sobre o metodo Seja Livre.

do.rule: Show pulse animation to draw attention

dont.rule: Don't cover important content
dont.rationale: Hide or reposition near footer CTAs

dont.rule: Don't make button too small on mobile
Don't use for non-WhatsApp contact

sectionDivider.description: Visual separator between content sections with optional dandelion motif.
sectionDivider.brandNotes: Dandelion seeds are core brand symbol representing freedom and transformation. Use subtly, not overly decorative.

do.rule: Use dandelion motif sparingly for key transitions
Match divider style to section importance

dont.rule: Don't overuse dandelion motif
Don't use heavy borders
dont.rationale: Brand aesthetic is light and airy

example.headline: Nada aqui ainda
example.subtext: Mas nao se preocupe, vamos construir isso juntas!

errorRecovery.description: How to handle and recover from errors

example.message: Algo deu errado, mas vamos resolver!

principles: Motion should feel natural and organic

reducedMotion.behavior: Disable non-essential animations, keep functional transitions
